text:
Bottle split at L42, thanks to Dave, 14/03/17. 
Translucent pour with no head - big shock hey?
Nose is lychee, sweet pissy stench, honey.
Taste comprises more lychee, melon balls, grains, lemon piss.
Medium body, still, sweet close.
No fan of this.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: March 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square. Big thanks to Wingman W. As Ozeki Josen Kinkan Sake. Pours like water to form a totally clear liquid with no head, but some legs. Aroma is banana cake, malted milk biscuit, butter biscuit. Body is light and smooth with low carbonation. Taste is booze cut with water, the water rice has been boiled in, starchy and plasticky, parafin with a spicy dry finish. I can drink this and in fairness theres nothing too offensive about it, but theres no pleasure to be had. It is very much a functional beverage, and if someone put it in front of me without telling me what it was I wouldnt guess it was fit for human consumption. (0.9)

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Daveo. Pours crystal clear with no colour. A little raw alcohol in the nose, vanilla, white rice. Medium sweet flavour with some further vanilla, more basic white rice, not much else. Medium bodied, a little oily. Finishes with mild boozy warmth, some oily vanilla, white pepper. Enjoyable stuff.

Bottle shared on Level 42 14/03/2017. A clear water no colour, no head. Aroma is spicy paint stripper, headache inducing. Flavour is composed. Flavour is composed of harsh alcohol, paint stripper. Terrible. Palate is oily paraffin, no condition.
Bottle share at Level 42 from Japan centre Soho. Pours clear with no head. Aroma is boozy rice with some potato and acetone. Taste is a little smooth, rice, booze. Not much else. Meh

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2017 Bottle care of Dave. It pours clear with no head. The aroma is soft, sweet, oily, rice, savoury, rice paper, raw alcohol, bit of creamy tapioca and acetone. The taste is smooth, soft, sweet, oily, milky, rice, paper, hint of tapioca, rubbing alcohol, boosty alcohol, candle wax and potato peelings with a boosty finish. Medium body and oily mouth feel. A bit shit.

Lukt: Lite duft, anelse ris og salt.
Utseende: Klar som vann.
Skum/kullsyre: Ikke skum.
Smak: Vassen ris smak med en alko varmer.

Kommentar: Serveres i Kald og Varm variant, Jeg prøvde kald.
Drukket Som Alias@ Ozeki Kinkan (Ozeki (Japan) Gold Label)
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear with no head. Aromas of light coconut. Taste is hot, rice wine. Boozy.
Bottle at Craigs, as what he had. Pours exactly like water, nose is fruity pineapple, earthy, taste is chalky, sweet.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2015 Bottle at home... Josen kinkanmjri taruzake... Pretty clear... Soft coconut... Floral fruits.. Light coconut husk... Soft fruits.. Light alcohol.. Big coconut husk... 


And again.. Coconut husk... Soft peppery linger.. Soft earthy rice...  3. 8
Small glass cup. Clear colour. Rice and light fruit with alcohol in the aroma. Ok mouthfeel. Rice alcohol and ild fruit, bit harsh finish. Sharp.

900ml "tetrapak" bottle brought for the ISHA Pula Conference NDP by our Japanese colleague Takuya (thanks!) This poured a typical clear body tinged with yellow. The nose was quite a shock actually, a distinct note of cocoa appears. It didnt follow into taste at first though. A distinct almost typical for a sake medicinal quality popped up, which I didnt like, but the mouthfeel was smooth and enjoyable and later on the medicinal qualities started to vanish and be replaced by the same strange cocoa-like note as before and it actually got enjoyable. Interesting stuff, not bad, even if its a futsu-shu.
